description: SVG assets for Equal Parts Challenge lesson with prerequisite assessment, wonder hooks, and adaptive scaffolding

assets.description: Hand showing fingers for counting 1-6, used in prerequisite micro-lesson
assets.alt: Hand showing fingers numbered 1 through 6 for counting practice

assets.description: Two cookie pieces side-by-side with VERY obvious size difference (one huge, one tiny) for initial 'equal vs different' assessment
assets.alt: Two cookie pieces with obvious size difference - one large, one tiny

assets.description: Three kids with different expressions based on piece sizes received (sad, neutral, happy) to assess fairness understanding
visualElements: Carlos with sad face + tiny piece
Maya with neutral face + medium piece
Luna with guilty face + large piece
assets.alt: Three children showing different emotions based on unequal cookie piece sizes

assets.description: Basic shapes (circle, square, rectangle) labeled for shape recognition prerequisite
assets.alt: Three basic shapes - circle, square, and rectangle - clearly labeled

assets.description: Circle divided into 2 equal parts with each half labeled '1/2' or 'one half'
assets.alt: Circle divided into two equal halves, each half labeled

assets.description: Two objects (cookies/pieces) with clear size difference for more/less comparison
assets.alt: Two cookies showing size comparison - one large labeled 'more', one small labeled 'less'

assets.description: Visual showing progression from whole circle → divided into 2 parts → divided into 3 parts
assets.alt: Progression showing a whole circle being divided into 2 parts, then 3 parts

assets.description: Luna's cutting attempt - three kids with unequal cookie pieces, faces showing emotions (disappointment, neutral, guilt)
assets.alt: Three kids looking at a cookie cut into three unequal pieces - one piece is noticeably larger than the others
assets.teachingMoment: Introduces fairness problem and equal vs. unequal comparison

assets.description: Simple warm-up: 3 circles with different divisions (1 equal, 2 unequal) for quick assessment
assets.alt: Three circles with different divisions - student identifies which has equal parts
assets.teachingMoment: Quick prerequisite check before main lesson

assets.description: Blank circle template for students to practice dividing into equal parts
assets.alt: Blank circle template for student to divide into equal parts

assets.description: Model showing circle correctly divided into 3 equal parts (120° each)
assets.alt: Circle divided into three equal parts like pizza slices
assets.teachingMoment: Shows correct equal partitioning strategy for circles

assets.description: Blank rectangle template for students to practice dividing into equal parts
assets.alt: Blank rectangle template for student to divide into equal parts
assets.teachingMoment: Transfer partitioning skill to rectangular shapes

assets.description: Model showing rectangle correctly divided into 4 equal parts (vertical lines)
assets.alt: Rectangle divided into four equal parts with vertical lines
assets.teachingMoment: Shows spacing strategy for rectangular partitioning

assets.description: Long rectangle (sub sandwich bar) divided into 6 equal parts
assets.alt: Long bar divided into six equal parts like a sub sandwich
assets.teachingMoment: Extends to larger numbers of equal parts

assets.description: Three shapes side by side: A has 4 equal quarters, B has 4 unequal parts, C has 3 equal thirds - student identifies which show equal parts
visualElements: Shape A: rectangle with 4 equal parts (correct)
Shape B: rectangle with 4 unequal parts (incorrect)
Shape C: circle with 3 equal parts (correct)
assets.alt: Three shapes for comparison - two show equal parts, one shows unequal parts
assets.teachingMoment: Tests discrimination between equal and unequal partitioning

assets.description: Circle divided into 3 equal parts with one shaded, showing 1/3 symbol with arrows connecting to visual
visualElements: Arrow from '1' to shaded part ('parts we have')
Arrow from '3' to whole circle ('total equal parts')
assets.alt: Circle divided into thirds with notation 1/3 and arrows showing what numerator and denominator represent
assets.teachingMoment: Connects symbolic notation to visual meaning

assets.description: Rectangle divided into 4 UNEQUAL parts, incorrectly labeled as '1/4' - student must critique
assets.alt: Rectangle divided into 4 unequal parts, incorrectly labeled as 1/4
assets.teachingMoment: Critical thinking - can student identify and reject incorrect fraction usage?

assets.description: Circle with dotted line showing fold strategy for making halves
assets.alt: Circle with dotted line showing how to fold to create equal halves

assets.description: Irregular shape (trapezoid or hexagon) for advanced students to partition
assets.alt: Irregular hexagon shape for advanced partitioning challenge

assets.description: Multiple shape options (circle, square, rectangle, triangle, hexagon) for student to choose and partition
assets.alt: Collection of different shapes for student to choose and practice partitioning

usageGuidelines.prerequisiteAssets: Show immediately if gap detected during wonder hook
usageGuidelines.wonderHookAssets: Use at lesson start for engagement + assessment
usageGuidelines.practiceAssets: Provide as canvas backgrounds or reference images
usageGuidelines.scaffoldingAssets: Show adaptively based on struggle detection
usageGuidelines.extensionAssets: Offer to fast learners who complete early

metadata.author: Simili Pedagogy Team
metadata.notes: 20 adaptive SVG assets spanning prerequisites → core content → extensions. Designed for invisible assessment and differentiated instruction.
